headline.print_headline: The Perils of Being Obese and Pregnant

docs.abstract: With the rise in obesity, more women who are pregnant, or trying to conceive, face added health risks, and sometimes the biases of doctors.
docs.snippet: With the rise in obesity, more women who are pregnant, or trying to conceive, face added health risks, and sometimes the biases of doctors.

headline.print_headline: First Lady Bucks GOP on School Lunch Rules
headline.main: First Lady Bucks GOP on School Lunch Rules

docs.lead_paragraph: First ladies typically avoid getting into public scraps, but Michelle Obama has jumped into perhaps her biggest battle yet.
docs.snippet: First ladies typically avoid getting into public scraps, but Michelle Obama has jumped into perhaps her biggest battle yet.

headline.print_headline: Berkeley Residents to Vote on Soda Tax in November
headline.main: Berkeley Residents to Vote on Soda Tax in November

docs.lead_paragraph: A California college town known for its liberal activism will vote in November on whether to place a penny-per-ounce tax on sugary beverages, touching off the latest obesity-fighting campaign in the United States.
docs.snippet: A California college town known for its liberal activism will vote in November on whether to place a penny-per-ounce tax on sugary beverages, touching off the latest obesity-fighting campaign in the United States.

headline.seo: Why the Research on Viewing Is Best Ignored
headline.print_headline: Please Tune Out Those TV Studies
headline.main: Please Tune Out Those TV Studies

docs.abstract: Neil Genzlinger Critic's Notebook questions validity of American Heart Association study asserting that watching too much television increases risk of early death in adults; points to changing nature of health pronouncements; argues death warning masks more complicated picture, and notes that some studies have shown benefits associated with television viewing.
docs.lead_paragraph: Neil Genzlinger takes a look at the runaway research on the effects of television viewing.
docs.snippet: Neil Genzlinger takes a look at the runaway research on the effects of television viewing.

headline.print_headline: White House Resumes Tours of First Lady's Garden
headline.main: White House Resumes Tours of First Lady's Garden

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House says tours of Michelle Obama's produce garden will be operating again soon.
docs.snippet: The White House says tours of Michelle Obama's produce garden will be operating again soon.

headline.print_headline: Napolitano Aims to Grow UC Role in Fighting Hunger
headline.main: Napolitano Aims to Grow UC Role in Fighting Hunger

docs.lead_paragraph: University of California President Janet Napolitano said Tuesday that she plans to leverage the state's role in agriculture and research to tackle one of the world's most pressing problems: food.
docs.snippet: University of California President Janet Napolitano said Tuesday that she plans to leverage the state's role in agriculture and research to tackle one of the world's most pressing problems: food.
